Comment: A decrease in the dollar is not necessarily a bad thing.  Countries purposely devalue their currency all the time in order to make exports more competitive and spur domestic production.  Sometimes the dollar falls when the Fed lowers interest rates and bonds go down.  Lower interest rates spur the economy.  Conversely higher rates can cool it off and lower inflation, and the dollar goes up usually.  This time however it doesn't seem planned.  It is a symptom of the disarray caused by a powerful but demented leader.   The markets have no idea what is coming next, the tariffs change day to day, he says stupid things all the time.  So businesses are circling the wagons and not investing just consolidating their liquid capital.  The money supply is shrinking so the economy will contract.  Apparently 80% of the voters who listed the economy as their major concern in the last election voted for the man with an abysmal track record of bankruptcies. Rational thinking has left the building.
